overview.ovdesc:
This table is used to define the parameters for defaulting while entering a BILL.REGISTER record. It also defines the Contract Category for various
BILL.TYPES and also determines the liability customer in case of a dishonour of a Bill for each defined Types.
Example
BILL.TYPE 1 could be a Bill with a feature of
Discounted Bill with Recourse.
BILL.TYPE 6 could be a Bill with a feature of
Collateral Bill with Recourse.
BILL.TYPE 2 could be a Bill
with a feature of Discounted Bill without a Recourse.

desc.p: This field defines the minimum tenor of the Bill that is acceptable. If the tenor of the Bill exceeds the defined parameter, an override message will appear.
Both minimum and maximum term must have same term (ie.Month or Days)
Months 1M, 2 M
Days 10, 365

This field defines the maximum tenor of the Bill that is acceptable. If the tenor of the Bill exceeds the defined parameter, an override message will appear. Both Minimum and maximum must have a same term (ie. Month or Days)
Months 1M, 2 M
Days 10, 365
This is an YES OR NO Field which will determine whether the BL.REGISTER of this type could be included in a Discount Contract.
YES or NO
This is an YES or NO field which will determine whether the BL.REGISTER of this type could be included in a Collateral Type of a Contract.
YES or NO

This is an YES OR NO Field which will determine whether the BL.REGISTER of this type could be included in a Discount Contract.
YES or NO
This field defines the nomenclature of the BL.Type.
The different type of the Bill could be
1. Bills Discounted with recourse
2. Bills Discounted without recourse
3. Bills Sent for collection .... etc
The description shall be defined as per the requirement of the User.
This is a free Text
Mandatory
3-50 type A (Alphanumeric) characters (Multivalue field)
For future use
For future use
This field can be used to specify the application format which will be used instead of the default value "1" while generating messages for BR's which has this BL.TYPE.
This allows the format of advices to be defined at the BL.TYPE level. When input is valid in this field, appropriate record should be available in the DE.FORMAT.PRINT file.
The value in this field will form the second part of the key to the file DE.FORMAT.PRINT. The key will be derived appending the value in this field to the literal 'BL'.

For example, input of a '2' in this field will mean that the key to DE.FORMAT.PRINT will be 405.BL2.1.GB instead of the default 405.1.1.GB. Thus there should be a record in DE.FORMAT.PRINT with id as 405.BL2.1.GB.
4 numeric characters.
Optional input. Default is 1 if left blank.
This is the key to BL.TYPE file.
All characteristics defined here for that BL.TYPE which will get defaulted during the input of Bill details in BL.REGISTER.
1-4 Numeric character
The category of the Bill (whether it is Discounted or Collection or Collateral) under which it will be reported has to be input in this field.
This field will be defaulted during the BL.REGISTER processing. Once authorised this field cannot be changed. To change existing category use New Category field.
ie. 21050 for Bills Discount or 30000 for Bills Collateral or 30001 for Bills Collection etc...
5 numeric characters. (Mandatory input)
The code entered must be present on the CATEGORY file.
This field defines the short description of the product defined.
Free Text Field.
Mandatory
3-15 type A (Alphanumeric) characters (Multivalue field)
This field defines the type of Product and conditions to be applied.
Allowed Products are - Discounting,Collection,Factoring,Forfaiting.
Not allowed with existing product definitions - DISCOUNT,COLLATERAL,COLLECTION.
This field defines whether the deal customer is liable in case of non settlement of bills.
Allowed Values are Yes, No, Partial.
Not allowed for Collection.
Default Value - 'Yes' for all other Products.
This field defines whether the Payment can be made in advance.
Allowed Values are "Allowed" and "Not Allowed".
Not Allowed for Product type Collection.
Must be Allowed for Product type Discounting.
Default Value - Allowed for other Product Types.
This field defines whether retention margin is applicable for the product type.
Allowed Values are "Allowed" and "Not Allowed".
Not Allowed for Product type Collection.
Allowed only when ADV.DISBURSEMENT is set to "Allowed".
This field defines whether contingent entry needs to be raised for retention margin amount.
Allowed values are "Yes" and "No".
Allowed only when RETENTION.MARGIN is set to "Allowed".
Allowed when ADV.DISBURSEMENT is set to "Not Allowed"(Collection).
If YES is chosen with RETENTION.MARGIN as "ALLOWED", contingent entry will be raised for the margin amount.
If YES is chosen with ADV.DISBURSEMENT as "NOT.ALLOWED", contingent entry will be raised for the bill amount.
This field defines whether partial disbursement is allowed against available discount amount for the product type.
Allowed values are "Allowed" and "Not Allowed".
Input to be allowed only when ADV.DISBURSEMENT is set to 'Allowed'.
Default Value - "Not Allowed".
This field defines whether partial settlement is allowed under the product type.
Allowed values are "Allowed" and "Not Allowed".
Default value - 'Allowed'.
This field defines whether re-discounting is allowed for the product.
Allowed values are "Allowed" and "Not Allowed".
Allowed only with Product Discounting.
Default value - "Allowed" for product Discounting and "Not Allowed" for other product types.
This field defines whether product type can be modified.
Allowed only when Product type is Collection.
Default value - "Allowed" for product Collection and "Not Allowed" for other product types.
This Field defines the party to be defaulted as liability customer in BL.REGISTER.
Allowed values are 'Buyer', 'Seller','Acceptor','Insurer' and None.
Mandatory Field When PRODUCT.TYPE is defined.
Must allow more than one party only when Recourse is set as 'Partial'.
Liability and info limit party cannot be same.
Must be "None" for Product Collection.
This field defines the party for maintaining information limit.
Allowed values are 'Buyer', 'Seller', 'Insurer', 'Issuing Bank' and 'Buyer-Seller'.
Must not allow more than two parties.
Must not allow duplicate parties.
Liability and info limit party cannot be same.
Mandatory when INFO.LIMIT.REFERENCE is defined.
This field defines the valid limit product for info limit party.
Mandatory when INFO.LIMIT.PARTY is defined expect for "Buyer-Seller".
Must be valid limit product from LIMIT.REFERENCE.
Must be defined as 'IN'(Info limit) in FX.TIME.BAND field in LIMIT.REFERENCE.
This field defines whether ageing process needs to be triggered if bill is not settled on maturity date.
Allowed values are Yes and No.
Mandatory when ADV.DISBURSEMENT is set to 'Allowed'.
This field defines whether accounting and limit updation should be consolidated when multiple invoices are processed under batch.
Allowed values are Yes and No.
Mandatory Field when PRODUCT.TYPE is defined.
